subject: GOT Titles
event:
Some wonderfully cool stuff about the creation of the GAME OF THRONES title sequence can be found here:

http://www.artofthetitle.com/

Go and enjoy.  I know I did.

The title sequence kicks ass.

comments.article: oh THAT is awesome!
I ADORE the title sequence and theme. Gets me excited to watch every time!

Since you mentioned it yourself...

Just what is that continent north of Essos supposed to be? Some filler Elastic put into the map, or is it a never-before-mentioned fourth continent now revealed?
There is no continent north of Essos, though there may be some islands (besides Ibben) and there is undoubtedly a polar ice cap.

that will draw the less-curious into the story. I love the clockwork, "game" sense of the title sequence, I think it is an excellent opening piece.

Love the whole thing so far, even though I'm cringing at some of the mean bits (at least I'm watching, some things I won't watch...).
comments.subject: That is an interesting bit

comments.article: Like the Lady scene?  I couldn't watch that.  I bawl every time I read it in the book, still.  Still!
comments.subject: Re: That is an interesting bit

comments.article: That song has been in my head for days, maybe weeks now.  And I'm happy for	it to stay!
Yeah... it pretty much lives in my head now. Also, hi again Polly's friend with the icon I like so much! xD
I love the music behind the title sequence; it's perfect.  Nice to see the reasoning behind the mechanical look, I couldn't quite figure out what they were going for.
I love that title sequence. It's got to be the best opener I've ever seen for any HBO show. I wonder if they'll do a new variation for the next season.
comments.subject: Awesome sequence

comments.article:
"...[the relief carvings on the shiny astrolabe-thing] tell about dragons attacking Westeros. They tell about how the different houses on Westeros got together and defeated those dragons, and how those houses, represented by their respective animals, bowed in allegiance to the Baretheon stag."

That's kinda not how I remember the history going...


(also, hi, love your work, long-time reader, first time commenter, totally glad 'Dance' will be out for my birthday, etc., etc...)
comments.subject: I think they didn't bother to do the reading...

comments.article:
"That's kinda not how I remember the history going..."

Yes and no.. it's simplified--but I think they were referring to Robert's Rebellion as the overthrowing of "the dragons"
comments.subject: Re: I think they didn't bother to do the reading...
Re: I think they didn't bother to do the reading...

comments.article: Yes, I'd love to hear the answer to that. Also, on one of the fly-by's of the astrolabe, it shows the dragon standing beside an erupting volcano. I wonder, is that the Doom of Valyria?
It's gotta be. What other place got destroyed by a volcano?(probably, I mean)
Woah, I just realized they have a huge landmass beyond the Sunset Sea. Is that canon or just concept?
We may get The Eyrie in the title sequence this week. :-)
And indeed we did!  How cool that the title sequence changes based on where the action is happening that week...

I couldn't agree more about the title sequence. It's gotten me pumped up all four times that I've watched it. Brilliantly novel visuals and classically rousing music score. They won't have to change it one bit, though that approach worked well for shows like The Wire.
comments.subject: Agreed

comments.article: Amazing!! The opening is wonderful!!! And the music makes it perfect!! EPIC!
I, too, ADORE that title sequence. I WANT that map  --   with or without the cool moving bits!

This is so cool, and so agonizing at the same time. They keep talking about how "if this existed within the world" and "monks poring over this big physical map"... and my mind keeps shouting:

THE MAP TABLE! THE MAP TABLE AT DRAGONSTONE!! IT'S PERFECCCTTTTTTT!

I don't know whether they read the books or not, and if they didn't it's quite a coincidence that they came up with pretty much the same idea. It would be rather cool to see the map table looking like the opening sequence, however.

I got goosebumps watching the title sequence during the series premiere and think they outdid themselves, including even minor details like the cage going up the Wall.  That being said, you'd think they'd pay attention to the House icons next to the actors/actresses names.  Sophie Turner (Sansa) shown as a dragon and Emilia Clarke (Daenerys) as a lion??  I do hope they'll fix these before the season's over.
comments.subject: LOVE the sequence...except for a couple of minor errors

comments.article:
I see that in episode one, it focuses on Pentos, and then after that to Vaes Dothrak. I wonder if they'll change it each week to highlight the places we'll see.

I guess we'll find out tonight, if it passes over the Vale or the Eyrie.
comments.subject: Changing each time.

comments.article:
Mr. Martin, I wrote the intro to the Art of the Title Sequence piece and helped put the whole feature together.

As a long time fan of your work, I must say that getting the thumbs up from you is extremely flattering. Glad you enjoyed it!
comments.subject: Thanks!

comments.article: well done!!
comments.subject: Re: Thanks!

comments.article:
The whole thing kicks ass. Episode 5 was so achingly good. My jury has come back and the verdict is that the HBO series is a rousing success. I eagerly await each weekly episode and watch them a few more times during the week that follows.

There truly was no better place for this than HBO, and they've done a splendid job turning my favorite books into a great show.
comments.subject: Kicks Ass

comments.article: I love love LOVE the title sequence! And the music is so incredible. Sigh...all so perfect :)
A man took the song and added a touch of Metal to it, and it's wonderful! I have it as my ring tone. The guitar, bass, and drum really fill the melody out, it's beautiful!
comments.subject: Have you heard the cover of the song in the opening sequence?
